body:
Problem:
build.zig always downloads dependencies and statically links them, which is frowned upon by distro packagers.

Solution:
Add option to use system libraries.

comment_data.body: Choosing minimum vs exact was completely vibes-based, tree-sitter was 0.26 in build.zig.zon and 0.25 in my distro so I chose minimum for tree-sitter and exact for the rest
Shelling out because using the C interface inside build.zig feels chicken-and-egg

Just like with cmake, having full control of the build (building all dependencies ourselves) should always be the default. This is also essential to make cross-compilation (which includes self-cross-compilation) work.

Using a system library should be opt-in per library (and then always use it, rather error than fallback. having no control whether something is dynamic or static is a recipe for misery). 

In theory "system integration options" of `zig build` are intended for this but not sure if they are actually useful or bring any benefit yet, if not we can always use plain options.

comment_data.body:
It doesn't seem to be discouraged as such, the style guide says it's only there
> in order to provide a point of reference, should anyone wish to point to an authority on agreed upon Zig coding style.

but it does say 4 spaces: https://ziglang.org/documentation/master/#Whitespace

I only did this because the file was already 4 spaces but the editorconfig kept making neovim start new lines at 2
so far I've just used `zig fmt` , and it only supports 4 spaces. There is no check in CI yet but we could add one.

this is for when a package is assembled somewhere and tarballed, with the intention of the tarball being extracted to `/usr`

So like in a PKGBUILD you would write `zig build install --prefix "${pkgdir}/usr" -Dinstall-path=/usr`

For Arch Linux you can try this PKGBUILD
```bash
# shellcheck shell=bash
# shellcheck disable=SC2034

declare srcdir pkgdir
pkgname=neovim-zig-git
_nvim_version=0.12.0
pkgver=0.12.0.r2609.gb8221f970d
pkgrel=1
pkgdesc='Fork of Vim aiming to improve user experience, plugins, and GUIs - built using zig'
arch=(i686 x86_64 armv7h armv6h aarch64)
url='https://neovim.io'
backup=('etc/xdg/nvim/sysinit.vim')
license=('custom:neovim')
depends=(
    libluv
    libutf8proc
    libuv
    lua51-lpeg
    luajit
    tree-sitter
    tree-sitter-c
    tree-sitter-lua
    tree-sitter-markdown
    tree-sitter-query
    tree-sitter-vim
    tree-sitter-vimdoc
    unibilium
)
makedepends=('git' 'zig>=0.15.2' 'tar')
optdepends=(
    'python-pynvim: for Python plugin support (see :help python)'
    'tree-sitter-bash: tree-sitter parser for bash'
    'tree-sitter-python: tree-sitter parser for python'
    'xclip: for clipboard support on X11 (or xsel) (see :help clipboard)'
    'xsel: for clipboard support on X11 (or xclip) (see :help clipboard)'
    'wl-clipboard: for clipboard support on wayland (see :help clipboard)'
)
provides=("neovim=${_nvim_version}" 'vim-plugin-runtime')
conflicts=('neovim' 'neovim-git')
source=(
    "git+https://github.com/p00f/neovim#branch=push-nwlkmnvmmlrt"
    "ziglua.tar.gz::https://github.com/p00f/ziglua/archive/1d276472c68c96f781aa2d0189a87c46355a8049.tar.gz"
    "https://github.com/neovim/deps/raw/06ef2b58b0876f8de1a3f5a710473dcd7afff251/opt/lua-dev-deps.tar.gz"
)
noextract=("ziglua.tar.gz" "lua-dev-deps.tar.gz")
b2sums=(
    'SKIP'
    'SKIP'
    'b27aa3bb208cbb68bac8b7722fb48fc76c4b862d19d1bc7564596316a25623d727c4d8d2e520c0abe416dc78b33c6aacd4b28968206b356e4fe80691886ca48b'
)

pkgver() {
    local nvim_version_git
    cd "${srcdir}/neovim" || exit 1
    _nvim_version="$(awk -F'"' '/\.version = "/ {print $2}' build.zig.zon)"
    nvim_version_git="$(git describe --always --dirty --match 'v*.*.*' | sed -E 's/^v[0-9]+.[0-9]+.[0-9]+-//; s/^([0-9]+)-([a-z0-9]+)/\1\.\2/')"
    printf "%s.r%s\n" "$_nvim_version" "$nvim_version_git"
}

prepare() {
    local zlua_hash lua_dev_deps_hash
    zlua_hash="zlua-0.1.0-hGRpC1dCBQDf-IqqUifYvyr8B9-4FlYXqY8cl7HIetrC"
    lua_dev_deps_hash="N-V-__8AAGevEQCHAkCozca5AIdN9DFc3Luf3g3r2AcbyOrm"
    cd "${srcdir}/neovim" || exit 1
    mkdir -p zig_deps && cd zig_deps || exit 1
    mkdir -p $zlua_hash
    tar xf "${srcdir}/ziglua.tar.gz" -C $zlua_hash --strip-components=1
    mkdir -p $lua_dev_deps_hash
    tar xf "${srcdir}/lua-dev-deps.tar.gz" -C $lua_dev_deps_hash --warning=no-unknown-keyword
}

build() {
    cd "${srcdir}/neovim" || exit 1
    zig build --system zig_deps -Doptimize=ReleaseFast -Dcpu=native -Dinstall-path=/usr
}

check() {
    cd "${srcdir}/neovim" || exit 1
    zig-out/bin/nvim --version
    zig-out/bin/nvim --headless -u NONE -i NONE -c ':quit'
}

package() {
    pushd . >/dev/null
    cd "${srcdir}/neovim" || exit 1
    zig build install --system zig_deps --prefix "${pkgdir}/usr" -Doptimize=ReleaseFast -Dcpu=native -Dinstall-path=/usr 
    rm "${pkgdir}/usr/bin/nlua0"
    rm -r "${pkgdir}/usr/runtime"

    install -Dm644 LICENSE.txt -t "${pkgdir}/usr/share/licenses/${pkgname}/"
    install -Dm644 runtime/nvim.desktop -t "${pkgdir}/usr/share/applications/"
    install -Dm644 runtime/nvim.appdata.xml -t "${pkgdir}/usr/share/metainfo/"
    install -Dm644 runtime/nvim.png -t "${pkgdir}/usr/share/pixmaps/"
    # shellcheck disable=SC2164
    popd >/dev/null

    # Make Arch Vim packages work
    mkdir -p "${pkgdir}"/etc/xdg/nvim
    echo "\" This line makes pacman-installed global Arch Linux vim packages work." >"${pkgdir}"/etc/xdg/nvim/sysinit.vim
    echo "source /usr/share/nvim/archlinux.vim" >>"${pkgdir}"/etc/xdg/nvim/sysinit.vim

    mkdir -p "${pkgdir}"/usr/share/vim
    echo "set runtimepath+=/usr/share/vim/vimfiles" >"${pkgdir}"/usr/share/nvim/archlinux.vim
}
```
